official_title: To direct the Secretary of Transportation to enter into an arrangement with Temple University to conduct a study on the impact on highway safety of distractions to drivers operation motor vehicles in the United States.

summary.text: Driver Distraction Prevention Act of 2000 - Directs the Secretary of Transportation to enter into an arrangement with Temple University's Institute for Survey Research, located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, to study and report to the Secretary and Congress on the impact on highway safety of distractions to drivers operating motor vehicles in the United States. Authorizes appropriations.
